text: Jack St. Clair Kilby (November 8, 1923 â€“ June 20, 2005) was an American electrical engineer. He helped discover the first integrated circuit while working at Texas Instruments (TI) in 1958. He was awarded the Nobel Prize in Physics on December 10, 2000.The Nobel Prize in Physics 2000. Nobelprize.org. Retrieved on 2013-11-21. Kilby was also the co-inventor of the handheld calculator and the thermal printer. ==References== Category:1923 births Category:2005 deaths Category:Engineers from Missouri Category:American inventors Category:Scientists from Missouri Category:Scientists from Dallas Category:Cancer deaths in Texas
title: Jack Kilby
